overview: If your vehicle has got a VIC marker it'll need to pass a VIC (Vehicle Identity Check) test before you can get a replacement registration certificate or renew its tax disc
title: Vehicle Identity Checks (VIC)
video_summary: Video on what a Vehicle Identity Check is, why you may need one if your vehicle is written off, and how to get your vehicle checked.

table.body:
If a vehicle is written off by an insurance company, they will usually tell DVLA so that a 'VIC marker' (Vehicle Identity Check marker) can be put on the vehicle record. 

If you own or buy the vehicle and want to keep it on the road, having a VIC marker means you can't get a replacement registration certificate and you won't be sent the V11 vehicle licence reminder you use to renew your tax disc. 

^To remove the VIC marker the vehicle needs to pass a VIC test.^

The VIC test compares the details DVLA has about the vehicle against the vehicle itself. It takes place at a VOSA (Vehicle and Operator Services Agency) VIC test centre.

*[VIC]: Vehicle Identity Check
*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[VOSA]: Vehicle and Operator Services Agency
table.title: Overview

table.body:
To find out if a vehicle has a VIC (Vehicle Identity Check) marker you can [make an online vehicle enquiry](https://www.taxdisc.direct.gov.uk/EvlPortalApp/app/enquiry?execution=e1s1 "make an online vehicle enquiry"){:rel="external"} or phone VOSA (Vehicle and Operator Services Agency) on **0300 123 9000**.

You’ll need to know the vehicle’s make and registration mark.

*[VOSA]: Vehicle and Operator Services Agency
*[VIC]: Vehicle Identity Check
table.title: Check if a vehicle has a VIC marker

table.body:
To apply for a Vehicle Identity Check (VIC) test fill out form VIC1 and submit it to VOSA (Vehicle and Operator Services Agency).

You can download the form and send it online if you’re going to pay by debit or credit card or use a VOSA pre-funded account.

Otherwise you can print the form out and apply by post.

$D

[Download VIC1 ‘Application for a Vehicle Identity Check’ (PDF, 262KB)](http://www.dft.gov.uk/vosa/repository/Application%20for%20a%20Vehicle%20Identity%20Check%20%28VIC%201%29.pdf "Download VIC1 ‘Application for a Vehicle Identity Check’ (PDF, 262KB)")

$D

Once VOSA gets your application they’ll contact you to take payment if you’re paying by credit or debit card.

Once they’ve processed your application you’ll be told when your VIC test is.

Normal opening hours for VIC test centres are 8am to 5pm Monday to Thursday and 8:30am to 4:30pm Friday.

^Tests can sometimes be arranged outside these hours - call VOSA on **0300 123 9000** for availability.^

##Applying by post

Download and print the [VIC1 form (PDF, 262KB).](http://www.dft.gov.uk/vosa/repository/Application%20for%20a%20Vehicle%20Identity%20Check%20%28VIC%201%29.pdf "VIC1 form") and send to VOSA with the [correct fee](vic-test-fees "correct fee")

$A

VIC Swansea
VOSA
Ellipse
Padley Road
Swansea
SA1 8AN

$A

##Applying in person

You can also hand the form in directly to a [VOSA VIC test station,](http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Dl1/Directories/UsefulContactsByCategory/MotoringContacts/DG_069953 "VOSA VIC test station"){:rel="external"} or fax it to them.

*[VOSA]: Vehicle and Operator Services Agency
*[VIC]: Vehicle Identity Check

table.body:
When you take your vehicle for a Vehicle Identity Check (VIC) test the following must apply:

- the vehicle must be roadworthy and able to be driven under its own power
- the vehicle must have a valid MOT if it needs one (if you're driving it to the VIC)
- the person driving the vehicle must be insured
- the vehicle must have front and rear number plates (if you're driving it to the test)

The test takes about 20 minutes and is a check of the vehicle's identity, not the quality of its repairs.

However, if the VIC inspector notices a serious defect which would make the vehicle dangerous to drive they may issue a 'prohibition notice'. This means the vehicle can't be driven until it's made roadworthy and the prohibition notice is removed. 

^You can drive your vehicle directly to and from a VIC without a tax disc.^

##If your vehicle passes its VIC

You’ll get a VIC20 pass certificate and DVLA will be told automatically.

The VIC marker will then be taken off your vehicle record and the V5C registration certificate will be marked to show ‘substantially repaired and/or accident damaged; identity checked on dd/mm/ccyy’.

##If your vehicle fails its VIC

You’ll get a VIC failure notice (VIC21) with the reasons for failure.

The case will then be investigated by the police or DVLA - this may take several weeks.

If the vehicle’s identity is then confirmed you’ll get your VIC20 pass certificate.

If the vehicle’s identity can’t be confirmed the VIC marker will remain on the vehicle record.

*[VOSA]: Vehicle and Operator Services Agency
*[VIC]: Vehicle Identity Check
*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
table.title: Taking your vehicle for a VIC test

table.body:
You can appeal if you don’t agree with the result of a Vehicle Identity Check (VIC).

Fill in a VIC17 ‘Vehicle Identity Check notice of appeal’ form and send to the VIC test station station manager with the [correct fee](vic-test-fees "correct fee") .

$D

[Download 'Vehicle Identity Check notice of appeal - form VIC17' (Doc (496KB)](http://www.dft.gov.uk/vosa/repository/Vehicle%20Identity%20Check%20Notice%20of%20Appeal%20(VIC%2017).doc "Download 'Vehicle Identity Check notice of appeal - form VIC17' (Doc (496KB)")

$D

*[VIC]: Vehicle Identity Check
